title: Wilhelm Lexis
summary: Wilhelm Lexis (17 July 1837, Eschweiler, Germany – 24 August 1914, Göttingen, Germany), full name Wilhelm Hector Richard Albrecht Lexis,[1] was a German statistician, economist, and social scientist.  The Oxford Dictionary of Statistics cites him as a "pioneer of the analysis of demographic time series".[2]  Lexis is largely remembered for two items that bear his name—the Lexis ratio and the Lexis diagram.
